{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |sex=women |Year=2001-02 |Prev year=2000-01 |Next year=2002-03 |Team=Connecticut Huskies |Image= |Conference=Big East Conference |ShortConference=Big East |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=39-0 |ConfRecord=16-0 |HeadCoach=Geno Auriemma |AsstCoach1= |AsstCoach2= |AsstCoach3= |StadiumArena=[[Harry A. Gampel Pavilion]] |Champion=Big East Champions |BowlTourney=[[2002 NCAA Women's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA Women's Division I Tournament]] |BowlTourneyResult= [[2002 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|Champions]] }} The '''2001â02 Connecticut Huskies women's basketball team''' represented the [[University of Connecticut]] in the 2001â2002 [[Division I (NCAA)|NCAA Division I]] basketball season. Coached by [[Geno Auriemma]], the Huskies played their home games at the [[XL Center|Hartford Civic Center]] in [[Hartford, Connecticut]], and on campus at the [[Harry A. Gampel Pavilion]] in [[Storrs, Connecticut]], and are a member of the [[Big East Conference]]. At the [[Big East Women's Basketball Tournament]], the Huskies won the championship by defeating Boston College 96–54. The Huskies won their third NCAA championship by defeating the [[Oklahoma Sooners]], 82–70.
==NCAA basketball tournament== *East Regional **Connecticut 86, St. Francis, Pennsylvania 37 **Connecticut 86, Iowa 48 **Connecticut 82, Penn State 64 **Connecticut 85, Old Dominion 64 *Final Four **Connecticut 79, Tennessee 56 **Connecticut 82, Oklahoma 70
